main event: Civilians reported seeing a cigar-shaped object with red lights at the extremities and a bright white light in the center, possibly flashing, over Mount Hood, Oregon.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 6-8 times as long as wide and in a vertical position.
Observers in the Government Camp area described the object as resembling the Mobilgas Red Flame, about the size of a blimp.
The Oakridge observers reported the object at about 12,000 feet over Mount Hood, while the Government Camp observers reported it at 1,000 feet south-southeast of Mount Hood.
The Oakridge observers reported that the object drifted to the north, while the Government Camp observer stated that it drifted to the south.
The observers of Aurora Borealis and Venus and other bright stars in the sky suggested the possibility of an optical illusion as the cause of this phenomenon.
sighted object: cigar-shaped object with red lights and a bright white light
witnesses: Civilians in Oakridge, Government Camp, and Eugene, Oregon
